data.text:
üöÄ Key Insights from Zack Kass Kass‚Äô Talk in Brazil ‚Äî Former Head of GTM at OpenAI 

Today I had the chance to watch an incredible talk by Zack Kass, who helped scale OpenAI‚Äôs GTM engine from $3M to $3B.
His perspective on where AI is heading is one of the clearest I‚Äôve seen.

üîå AI as ‚ÄúUnmetered Intelligence‚Äù

Zack describes AI as the next utility ‚Äî like electricity or water.
We‚Äôre moving toward a world where intelligence becomes abundant, cheap, and always-on, forcing companies to differentiate on what‚Äôs truly human:
empathy, courage, creativity, wisdom.

‚ö° Asymmetric Adoption

Even when technology is ready, society may not be.
Some sectors will resist automation, while others will leap forward ‚Äî we may cure diseases before we see fully autonomous vehicles.
AI‚Äôs impact will be uneven, political, and unpredictable.

üè¶ The Real Transformation: Access

AI will unlock services for populations that never had access to them ‚Äî
banking, insurance, healthcare, education.
The real revolution isn‚Äôt about job replacement; it‚Äôs about serving millions who were previously invisible to the system.

ü§ñ What‚Äôs Next

The rise of the agentic internet (machines browsing and acting for us)

Individuals and companies discovering their automation boundaries

A new competitive landscape where agents decide which brands truly matter


Zack‚Äôs talk reinforced what I‚Äôve been seeing across markets:
AI is not just a cost-cutting tool ‚Äî it‚Äôs reshaping business models, customer experience, and entire industries.

Brilliant session. Obrigado, Zack. üáßüá∑‚ú®

#ai #gtmengineer #gtm #growth #openai

"Go to Market is about semantics"


yesterday was ths first and inspiring Masterclass at the GTM Engineer Certification with SCIENT from Giovanni Salvador Matheus Pinheiro! we had the pleasure to listen to Edson Rigonatti, an investor who guided us through the principles of an elite Go-To-Market strategy. 

He highlighted the importance of being a ‚ÄúMister Miyagi‚Äù of growth, prioritizing efficiency over brute force ü•ã.

Edson introduced the concept of the Go-To-Market Engineer üß†, someone who focuses on human productivity and solves one bottleneck at a time, following the Theory of Constraints. He also presented the Product Maslow Pyramid üß±, showing that it‚Äôs always easier to sell solutions for burning-hair problems üî• ‚Äî those that truly hurt.

üí° Key Insights:

üéØ Focus is everything: Lack of focus causes 90% of failures. Prioritize one ICP and one use case to standardize the journey.

üë• Human Productivity: A sales machine stands only when you can prove and scale the productivity of your sellers.

üß© Do it manually before automating: The path is: Human Action ‚Üí Template ‚Üí BPM ‚Üí Code. Don‚Äôt automate what you haven‚Äôt validated.


Which of these principles are you already applying ‚Äî or planning to apply ‚Äî in your GTM strategy? Share your thoughts in the comments!

#GoToMarket #GTM #Sales #Entrepreneurship #Efficiency #Focus #Productivity #Startup #Masterclass üöÄ

NVIDIA is committing ¬£2bn to AI startups from Oxford and across the UK.

Great to have joined many colleagues and friends at the launch tonight in London, with NVIDIA founder Jensen Huang standing alongside Sir Keir Starmer telling the group, ‚ÄúThis is the age of AI ‚Äî the big bang of a new Industrial Revolution back in the country where that revolution began.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe will support the largest AI infrastructure investment the UK has ever seen, the largest supercomputer, and we will continue to expand our commitment to great UK startups. This marks a historic moment and the UK and US will stand together.‚Äù 

Scaling world-class AI companies here has been incredibly challenging, despite success stories like Google DeepMind, Isomorphic Labs and Helsing. We‚Äôve had limited access to compute, limited venture capital outside London, rising energy costs and real difficulties in backing founders at our world-class research centres, including the University of Oxford.

NVIDIA, in collaboration with Accel, Air Street Capital, Balderton Capital, Hoxton Ventures and Phoenix Court  is going to accelerate the UK‚Äôs AI ecosystem by providing new capital for AI startups. 

We‚Äôre looking forward to working closely with Nvidia and the great investors involved to launch world-changing AI ventures. 

We‚Äôve already backed awesome teams from Oxford in AI-first drug discovery, clinical decision-making, and complex robotics and embodied AI. Alongside awesome Oxford spin-outs like Oxa we‚Äôre building the future AI we want to see and that the world needs.

Congratulations and thanks especially to Tobias Halloran, James Wise, Hussein Kanji, Sonali De Rycker and Saul Klein.

More to come from Oxford and the great folk assembled in London tonight.

data.text:
I filmed this video almost 12 months to the day. Something struck me when watching this again - whilst the sentiments still ring true, the advancement in only 12 months is astounding. FCamara Consulting & Training has delivered over 50+ AI-related projects in the last 12 months, and this is only the beginning. Every week, we are talking to existing and new customers about how to advance their adoption or reframe their strategy.

As the world becomes more 'aware' of the impact of AI on how we work, how we understand and use data, plus its environmental impact. The worldwide adoption of AI is asking different questions of us. For example, there are approximately 2.5 billion (with a B) daily prompts generated, which consumes 804,000 litres of water, which is the equivalent of half an Olympic swimming pool every day!

AI is here to stay and can be a force for good. However, negative press and mass job losses only fuel the fire and prey on the fear of those without the knowledge to adapt. FCamara Consulting & Training can help your business to embrace the new world and thrive.
